Review.Titre: Something is fishy with this company
Review.Contenu: Something is fishy with this company. I rolled over my IRA from Fidelity to iTrust to long term hold crypto a year back. I am starting to find out that their support is non existent and not willing to help you log into your own account. Their KYC has been showing up error for a couple of days now and I am afraid that they might be insolvent. I have been trying to reach out to them but one guy tells me my request has been sent to the engineers and no response thereafter.

Review.Titre: Faulty system empty apologies
Review.Contenu: Be careful putting any funds here, I have been unable to purchase crypto for months now. I have 3k available USD and when I try to buy any asset and it says failed to execute order. When I speak to customer service they are apologetic and keep saying give us a few more days. I appreciate the apology but I would prefer to have the use of my funds. Luckily I only have lunch money in there. If anyone is considering putting what they deem a lot of money in the hands of itrust I would first consider the fact that when things go wrong they will say sorry its out of our control.

Review.Titre: Missing money attempted to roll over 401K
Review.Contenu: Attempted to roll over 401K.  Previous Financial Institution confirmed money sent to iTrust seven (7) days ago. iTrust does not show money, and now they can't be reached by phone (7 attempts), and 6 emails without response.  Have they shut down!?  I'm starting to panic.

Review.Titre: I cannot add funds to my existing…
Review.Contenu: I cannot add funds to my existing account. I have a connected bank account, but, I keep getting the message to add a bank account. . I keep getting recycled thru the process of “add bank account “. Then a message comes up saying I’ve successfully added my bank. When I try to add funds the same request for connecting my bank comes up constantly. “Customer service has not been able to rectify this glitch. They told me a number of customers have had the same problem. I’m ready to transfer my Roth account to another platform.

Review.Titre: Run don't walk away this company
Review.Contenu: Run don't walk away this company! They don't take calls because of the high volume of calls they receive. Don't bother using their ticket system, they won't respond to tickets either. 'We received it today' means 'we received it a week ago'. 'We are processing it today' means 'we may never process it'. 'You'll receive the money at your new custodian in 1-3' days means 'leave me alone'. I'm trying to be very objective with my review in the hopes that this company takes the feedback to heart and reassesses how they do business. Everything I said can be backed up with written proof.

Review.Titre: Transaction Fraud
Review.Contenu: I executed several transactions this morning for Bitcoin.  All these transactions showed an amount $100's below $30,000.  Yet all of my transactions beginning yesterday evening show for exactly $30,000.  Unfortunately I didn't go back and look into transaction history until after I had done many transactions.  I'm shocked!  I wonder if these kinds of things happen with fidelity.  Considering moving my money.

Review.Titre: Customer service is slow and sends…
Review.Contenu: Customer service is slow and sends generic responses rather than responding like humans asking actual questions. And the app is super buggy, it's borderline useless. With all the banks going down, particularly in crypto, I wouldn’t trust these guys to stick around.

Review.Titre: Uncalled for and unethical mode of…
Review.Contenu: Uncalled for and unethical mode of customer servicing. Till date gotten no response to the issue i raised exactly a week ago. I'm convinced they are just incompetent because scam report consensusSRCSS, had issued a chainalysis audit and warnings on their networks earlier, had I saw that before handling my money to them, would not have fell for the IRA gimmicks. Check a chance of opting out, professional guidance on deck are excused. Having opting eighty per cent is better than losing all.

Review.Titre: Company delisted MANA and ALGO tokens…
Review.Contenu: Company delisted MANA and ALGO tokens without any notice!  I now cannot sell those tokens and have no control over them!  Highly unprofessional!  Also, NO follow up communications from CEO/management regarding this!

Review.Titre: Site Went Down - Had No Access to Stocks for Weeks
Review.Contenu: The site went down in the summer of 2022 for 5 days (July 29th until August 2nd) without any communication from iTrust Captial for days. None of us had a clue as to what was going on and why everyone had no access to their retirement IRA / Crypto accounts. Hopefully, such things like this will never happen again, because it was a long scary week for all of us, and we thought all our savings would be lost. In addition, they also don't have any capability of allowing us users the safely secure any crypto stock to a wallet or hardware device for safekeeping like a Ledger. If they have another shutdown like before, your crypto stock and retirement savings could be lost for good. The only thing I like about them is that they have a 1% fee on purchases. But other than this, their service and interface is very lacking.

Review.Titre: Compliance department is horrible!
Review.Contenu: I received a distribution in 2021 and my taxes withheld weren’t remitted to the state properly. I have been working with customer relations for over a month and a half and they have been unable to get it corrected with the custodian. They also screwed up the original distribution. Two interactions and two problems. Batting 0%!  I am seriously report my experience to the Department of Labor.

Review.Titre: I have been though 3 transfers…
Review.Contenu: I have been though 3 transfers personally and every time is different. It seems like iTrust can't be consistent. The worst part is that when you talk to any reps its like talking into the wind. iTrust is going to make there money regardless but its still early in this game and hopefully the future brings us an entity that listens to the customer more. Also you can forget about referral rewards they want you to open an account with a particular service in order to get it. They probably get paid by them to gain users. I already have Paypal which is one of the ones they list as using but they wanted me to open an account with the other one they use. Why couldn't I get it with the one I already have! Just when I thought I was done in order to wright this review they will automatically create an account for me with Trustpilot. Great!

Review.Titre: FIDELITY MAY BE A BETTER OPTION?!
Review.Contenu: SEC mentioned ALGO and MANA, and management immediately delisted these tokens.  ALL other tokens (except Bitcoin) can also get delisted any time by management.  For only the Bitcoin offering, might as well TRANSFER TO FIDELITY!

Review.Titre: Distribution haven't arrived
Review.Contenu: I have been waiting for my Distribution for a month. Customer service said that it was sent out on October 11, 2022.  And it will take 2 to 3 weeks for you to receive it.  Well, I didn't receive it.  I spoke to Zach on November 2, 2022, said wait till to 5th of November 2022.  It didn't arrive.  I called Zach the following Monday.  Won't be in the office all week.  So, I was transferred to Trent.  Gave the circumstances said that he will research it and will call me back.  He did call me back.  Informed me that distribution will overnight my distribution.  Its November 10, 2022, and I still haven't received my distribution that was supposed to be over night.  I didnt get a tracking number or what way was it coming through USPS, FEDEX or UPS.  I was just informed I will get it overnight.  If I knew I was going to get this much problem to receive my distribution.  I wouldn't have moved my funds from Fidelity.  Trent is helpful.  He is just going by what distribution is telling him.

Review.Titre: Itrust not answering calls or email. Panic!
Review.Contenu: I transferred money on a roll over and itrust did confirm they have the funds. It has now been over a week and they have not made the funds available. I have called and was told tomorrow. Now they won't answer the phone and not responding to email. I believe something bad has happened.

Review.Titre: Way too risky
Review.Contenu: Way too riskyiTrustCapital uses coinbase as the custodian. Yikes!If coinbase bankrupts, all my crypto will be gone. If coinbase or itrustcapital loses my crypto (via hack, breach, third party bankruptcy, theft, etc..), [EDITED AND REMOVED LINES HERE 9/20/2022 on risk and loss as iTrustCapital is requesting Trustpilot to delete this post.]iTrustCapital does not offer an insurance option to protect against loss of customer crypto. Either by coinbase's mistake, iTrustCapital's mistake, or third parties. If they lose it, It's just gone and thats that.iTrustCapitals Terms of Service is dodgy at best. Their faq's are crafted to impress on the customer a safe investment experience, when that couldn't be further from the truth.Only cash held at iTrustCapital is FDIC insured. If any loss of customers crypto happens, TOS says iTrustCapital may only be liable for damages up to $100. I was keeping more than $100 on their platform.I left because of the above risk. Thats way way too much risk for me to keep any crypto on their platform.This platform is 'Not your keys, not your crypto.' which is never ok unless there is a third party insurance option protecting against complete loss by all and any parties.I did notice a few other red flags:1. Their spread is huge on top of high transactional fees.2. Their platform is bare bones basic and it doesn't look like they've made any considerable investment into it, giving me the impression its a fly by night operation.3. Selling on their platform was suspiciously unavailable at critical times during the last crash (but that was probably coinbase's doing).

Review.Titre: Worst customer service I’ve had in my…
Review.Contenu: Worst customer service I’ve had in my life.  I don’t normally write reviews but people should be warned.Once they have your money they don’t respond to emails for support and if you try to call you get a queue.  Once you make it to the top of the queue an automated voice says they aren’t taking calls and it hangs up on you. I have no problem with a queue, the fact the system hangs up on you stating "we are not taking calls at this time" is a problem after waiting in a queue for 30 minutes. It keeps stating my credentials are wrong but they are not as I've been using saved credentials (username/password). I try to reset password and they are supposed to send an email.  The email doesn't come and I've tried a dozen times with different devices.I’ve had at least 10 issues with my account since inception a year ago.  Most have to do with inability to log into account through any format (app, phone, computer, safari or chrome). On days the market is eventful are the days you cannot get into your trading account and screwed you out of thousands of dollars.  I've been unable to log in since Monday with NO RESPONSE but they respond here immediately! What a jokeThey’ve also been hacked once and customers have lost access to their account for over a week When I eventually get into my account I plan on moving my money to a reputable IRA and not a scam like this one

Review.Titre: More delays in distributions!
Review.Contenu: IT seems iTrust Capital has a hard time processing distributions.  This is the 3rd time I have had a distribution.  The first time took 3-4 weeks.  The second time with Jared Feldman hand holding the process, has completed in about 2 weeks.  Now again with this distribution it has already been 20 days for a simple cash distribution.  Their documentation on the support website states 7-10 days from when the documentation is signed.  That was 16 days ago and it has been 10 days since I had a verification call.  I was told it would only take 3-5 days.  The company is very good about doing everything they can to get your money, but has very poor customer service when you try to get it back.Update:  As the distribution was only completed today after this review and several emails, I find it odd iTrust Capital feel the a request made on 12 days after the verification call and 19 days after the request meets the 7-10 days statements on the support page.  The only time iTrust met this time period was while Jared was hand holding my send distribution. Read through the 1 and 2 start review.  This is a common theme for trying to reach support for a distribution.

Review.Titre: We had such high hopes when we started…
Review.Contenu: We had such high hopes when we started investing with this company initially. Unfortunately, our experience was highly disappointing; we are closing our account with them immediately. We found the #iTrustCapital company very unprofessional, unethical, and dishonest. I rarely give negative reviews, but if I could give them negative stars, I would. #IRA #Crypto #Investors, Beware!

Review.Titre: My husband left so many voicemails and…
Review.Contenu: My husband left so many voicemails and nobody calling back, he sent an email and they responded by demanding so many things, and now, when we are ready, they stop responding! You can give them money, but they will not return it! It is a scam! I want my money back!!!! Respond to is! Give our money back! We lost 24 k with them and now we can not get rest of the money! Stay away ! Run!!! Don’t invest with them

Review.Titre: Itrustcapital is good.
Review.Contenu: When I signed up on the app. My bank was not listed at first. I found my $1000 and it was an error on my banks side. I will invest with Itrustcapital again.

Review.Titre: slow to answer questions
Review.Contenu: you guys take so long to get back with answers to questionsno phone servicestill no referral bonus

Review.Titre: You need to offer staking for Ethereum
Review.Contenu: You need to offer staking for Ethereum. Ethereum is the preeminent crypto currency and holders like myself in a retirement account would benefit tremendously from staking their holdings and letting it compound over time.

Review.Titre: Conditional Transaction feature is a HOAX!
Review.Contenu: I watched 2 ITrustcapital “How-to” videos on the new conditional transaction Buy/Sell feature.Nowhere is it said that any conditional transaction submitted is at risk of filling outside of the conditional buy/sell order price and to use at your own risk.I made 2 separate conditional buys, each for $100k a piece.  The first was for $17,500 or lower.  It filled at, $17,577.  The second was for $17,000 or lower.  It filled at, $17,337.In both instances the Conditional transactions failed to fill their respective Conditional Price or lower. Why use it if it doesn’t work as explained in their videos?I was subsequently told by Trent, that the Conditional Transaction feature is not the same as a limit order.Then say so on your 2 videos explaining the Conditional Trade feature to your users!  I mean, am I wrong?ITrustCapital puts itself first by being intentionally deceptive.  They are only interested in attracting your business and charging you a hefty commission.As a customer my expectations are reasonable: TransparencyTrustHonesty & Integrity.ITrustCapital failed on my Conditional Buy Orders and then failed to make me whole.Not the kind of experience a customer expects.  Particularly with the current FTX insolvency debacle where customer trust has never been more important. Trent didn’t even have the stones/courtesy to return my call, but instead sent me an email response stating they address the Conditional Trade features inability to do as they claim/advertise (see both of their videos) in the FAQ.Deceptive and untrustworthy.ITrustcapital‘s behavior is exemplary of what will cause excessive government intrusion/oversight/regulation to the crypto ecosystem - limiting the benefit of decentralization.Makes you wonder, what else is bogus with ITrustcapital?

Review.Titre: Been waiting for ACH transfer to bank…
Review.Contenu: Been waiting for ACH transfer to bank for two weeks now. Phones are not picked up.

Review.Titre: I requested a distribution on 6-29-22…
Review.Contenu: I requested a distribution on 6-29-22 for the 3rd time.  They kept requesting the same information over and over and when I called I always got a different person with a promise to call or email me which never happened.  As of today I have not received my distribution.This is completely unacceptable especially now that no one answers the phone and you can't log in.Nothing adds up and there is no transparency or honesty.

Review.Titre: If I could give it Zero Stars I would.
Review.Contenu: If I could give it Zero Stars I would.Started a distribution process 19July and still have not received it.Message every day but have not had one message returned or responded to. Unable to contact anyone on phone or schedule a phone conversation.Avoid this Company at all cost.

Review.Titre: They lost my checks and when I emailed…
Review.Contenu: They lost my checks and when I emailed them about it, they ghosted me. It took me over a month just to get someone to respond. They only responded because I reached out to them on Twitter on three separate occasions. They responded by admitting they had poor customer service and handled the situation unprofessionally. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Review.Titre: My account got locked out
Review.Contenu: My account got locked out, keeps telling me update app yet every time I try update it takes me back to Apple App Store and does not update. It’s quite concerning. Also I have sent multiple emails requesting them to remove a pending transfer request on my app that has been sitting there for months,and no one calls nor replies to me.  It’s a shame.

Review.Titre: Slow on support
Review.Contenu: Im having problems getting in contact with support in a timely manner.  I set up a phone call for 5 on Friday. I got a text saying to remember phone call just before 5.  I never received a phone call from anybody.  I also keep getting emails saying I need to sign something in my documents but nothing shows up.  I was told to do this five days ago.  Please helpRonny

Review.Titre: Wrong develpment focus
Review.Contenu: So far, they have failed to provide basic trading options like limit orders of any kind or stop limits.  Instead they've chosen to focus their time on creating a mobile app that is not available on android.  Basic functions available to everyone on their website would have been appreciated before they went fluffing iPhone users with a weak mobile experience.

Review.Titre: Absolutely abysmal
Review.Contenu: Absolutely abysmal.  I honestly cannot imagine who would want to use this service for a number of reasons:  ZERO phone support (despite the fact that I requested a callback), ZERO e-mail support, and the extreme difficulty logging in from my own laptop at my own home from which I created the account make for a complete disaster.  I'm going to stick with tdameritrade.  This company is a total waste of time.  Never again.

Review.Titre: My account went down after placing 3…
Review.Contenu: My account went down after placing 3 trades (buys) and now shows zero balance (100% of my funds are missing), zero assets, and the support form crashed 3 times while I was trying to report it. So far, this company is severely breaking my trust and it seems neither safe nor stable. Wildly unprofessional for a company that markets itself as the leading crypto IRA provider, and offering 24/7 trading ability. Literally thousands of dollars completely missing right now. Very upsetting.

Review.Titre: Well Im trying to set up an account but…
Review.Contenu: Well Im trying to set up an account but since I work in a sensitive arena I only have a PO Box. I also live in a rural area and my physical address is different than my mailing address( the PO box). Soooo, my utility bill doesnt show my entire physical address, I use propane, the bank statements go to the PO box and all I hear is 'we need some thing showing your physical address' . What is the point of the govt issued photo ID and since everything will be going by email what's the problem with the PObox????

Review.Titre: Still waiting...
Review.Contenu: Still waiting for my IRA funds to transfer - it's been months. I've never seen a transfer take this long. No updates, no follow-up, poor communication. So far I'm not happy.I was wanting to transfer my wife's IRA here also but I don't think I'll be doing that now.

Review.Titre: Discrimination Against Green Card Holder
Review.Contenu: My wife, who lives with me here in the United States, tried to create an account with Itrustcapital. They refused to let her create an account; they are discriminating against her simply because she is a green card holder. They treated her horribly. She provided all required documentation, including proof of residence; but Itrustcapital refuses to even have a conversation with her, they just said "we can't help you." We're married, she lives here with me in the United States, she has a green card, and she HAS A UNITED STATES SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER.

Review.Titre: Don't execute MARKET orders unless you are want to get robbed.
Review.Contenu: I just executed a market buy for BTC and the execution price was $120 over the limit order buy price. What a scam. BTC price never got even close to my execution price.

Review.Titre: Update. An iTrust representative did reach out because of the outage. It lasted one day and I have since placed additional trades with ease.
Review.Contenu: Set up was easy. Then came time to place trades...Internal server errors, trades don't get executed, and I can't get any response because of course you can only message or schedule a call, and by the way, calls for November are booked.. so I guess I wait and hope that they honor the trades I put to them...Finger crossed!

Review.Titre: My Account balance went to Zero
Review.Contenu: Today when I got in my account, the balance showed zero for a long time and that really freaked me out. After a long while my correct balance appeared.  Also something that was very strange was the word "None" was added to my account name.  I don't know what this is about.  This makes me feel insecure about putting my assets with ItrustCapital.  Also you can't just pick up the phone to talk to people when things like that happen.  You still got to send an email to customer service and hoping that someone will respond to you in a timely manner. This really sucks!!!!

Review.Titre: The worst customer service …
Review.Contenu: The worst customer service I have ever tried to deal with.Tried to transfer Roth and 401 k snd after 2 weeks nothing. Nothing from itrust to help the transfer not even an email to assist in any way. Cancelled account an then Itrust attempted to contact me. Stay away from this company.

Review.Titre: Extremely bad customer service and…
Review.Contenu: Extremely bad customer service and platform and HUGE GIANT transaction fees, I lost lot of my money in their fees. NEVER fix technical issues on time.Only invest if you WANT to LOSE your MONEY like I have in these fraudsters

Review.Titre: Doesn't offer hardly any help when to…
Review.Contenu: Doesn't offer hardly any help when to comes to figuring out the tax side, doesn't offer real trading options (only market purchases), doesn't offer a real trading platform like advertised, 1% adds up too quick for short term trading.

Review.Titre: This company has no idea how to onboard…
Review.Contenu: This company has no idea how to onboard customers. Requires extremely manual steps and provides no guidance or support - you have to become a Project Manager and spend significant periods of time on this. And don't expect to get any questions answered from iTrust when you encounter issues.

Review.Titre: Seriously must I give a whole Star oh…
Review.Contenu: Seriously must I give a whole Star oh well here goes. This company moves at a speed that makes glaciers appear fast and that was before Global Warming. Start your account a month before you want one. They should say we are low cost because :We are very slow and you will do most of the heavy lifting. I would like to see them list their average times in (weeks) it takes to get accounts funded.

Review.Titre: Wired funds to fund our account and it…
Review.Contenu: Wired funds to fund our account and it has been 5 days and still no funds!  Called after the 3 day and they assured me the funds would post to my account by the end of the day.   Emailing their support is completely useless, never a response.  Phone support is essentially the run-around. After numerous calls to support and asking for a manager, the story changed to it's in the "conversion stage" and will take another 7-10 business days before account is funded.  What Planet are these people on?!!! This sounds like a centralized bank. Very disappointed that I trusted this company. Should have used a way more reputable company that deals in crypto.

Review.Titre: EXTREMELY POOR AND NONEXISTENT CUSTOMER SERVICE
Review.Contenu: It appears that this is the only platform where iTrustCapital is responding. What is going on with ZERO follow-up month after month after month with my pending funds?? I have emailed and emailed with zero follow-up. There is no longer ANY phone number to contact and investors need to know that iTRUST is #NOTRUST at this point. This needs to be resolved ASAP. I have been patient for months but this I promise you WILL blow this out of the water so all other investors are aware. I need follow up with my account asap - transparency, mitigation and follow through. Are you a brand that aligns with these practices???

Review.Titre: Never Again
Review.Contenu: So, here I sit, unemployed and stuck in a foreign country with very little cash. I tried to make a withdrawal from my account but it became such a pain that I decided to close my account . . . a month ago. Closing the account has become just as big a pain as trying to take a disbursement. I understand that there was a paperwork glitch (my fault) but this has been going on for weeks. Real quick to take your money, not so quick to let it go.

Review.Titre: I have not been able to log into my…
Review.Contenu: I have not been able to log into my account for over a week and no one at ITrustCapital seems to think it’s a priority to resolve no matter how many times I call them.

Review.Titre: The site is crashed
Review.Contenu: The site is crashed, the app is crashed and your boiler plate tweets are hollow. With Celsius Voyager and the others collapsing the lack of transparency is unacceptable

Review.Titre: This company is NOT regulated!
Review.Contenu: Used them for years and then I got a letter saying I had to liquidate all my crypto by December 17th 2021 because I lived in NY!  I did some research and found out that they are not regulated and that's why they can't sell to NYers.  When I set up an appointment and I asked WHY they couldn't keep my account (mind you, I already knew), all I got was "IRAs are complicated" and "I don't know".All those years of paying a monthly fee and getting nothing for it and now they want me to sell my XRP in order to keep my account...Move on, there are other companies that ARE regulated, do your own research.

Review.Titre: response time
Review.Contenu: The customer service response time is slow. It is over 1 week to schedule a 5 min call.I put in a request to transfer funds into my account and was contacted by an agent who process the request same day.  Within about 6 hours from request.

Review.Titre: Struggling to get customer support
Review.Contenu: It is interesting seeing iTrustCapital responding to reviews earlier today when they still have not responded to customer's emails from last week. Perhaps this is the best way to get the attention of their customer service team?

Review.Titre: Can't trust crypto if they lost 4 FedEx pkgs
Review.Contenu: My first funding operation went well but that was when I opened my account. Subsequent funding attempts of my account failed 4 times before I wondered whether I can trust them to keep my crypto safe when they keep losing the transfer of funds application via FedEx !!

Review.Titre: Worst Company I’ve done business with.
Review.Contenu: Worst Company I’ve done business with.. to many issues to list. They don’t want to fix anything, they just want to blame everybody else for there Inexperience

Review.Titre: I LOVE the idea of buying crypto…
Review.Contenu: I LOVE the idea of buying crypto through an IRA, so after I saw the commercial, I jumped at starting one.  Right out of the box, a critical form automatically filled in the wrong phone number.  There were only two choices, Docu-sign it to accept it, or reject it.  The only obvious way to communicate with them was to make an appointment a week later.Errors in documents that are not easily corrected and bad communication methods made this a terrible customer experience for me.I only stated the facts of the situation.  I said nothing personal about the rep.  He took it personally and was NOT polite to me.  You recorded the call.  Replay it and see WHO WAS RUDE TO WHOM.

Review.Titre: Frustrating long process for Roth conversion
Review.Contenu: For anyone reading this rating please note it is poor simply because of the frustratingly slow process itrustcapital has for doing a Roth backdoor conversion. They received my money to my traditional IRA 10 days ago and it took that long for the conversion to post to my Roth account. As you can imagine in crypto the volatility of pricing has caused me to be frustrated. In my situation I missed out on $1,200 of earnings at the time I posted my purchase. Anyone who is looking to do a similar backdoor conversion from their traditional IRA to a Roth IRA within itrustcapital must be prepared for at minimum a 10-day process. And as usual communication with Itrustcapital was also frustrating and very slow.

Review.Titre: You guys need to work on your processes
Review.Contenu: I've been trying for 3 months to shut down my account. Now, as of Jun 26, the money was moved out of my account. My account balance is $0. But there is no signs of where that money went. Was supposed to go to my Fidelity account, but it did not.  Where is my money????

Review.Titre: Absolutely trash company
Review.Contenu: Absolutely trash company, not only charge 1% fee on your crypto purchases, but also sell you more expensive than the actual market price, so you will realize a drop immediately after you purchase it. Trash.

Review.Titre: Appalling.....
Review.Contenu: After one year of an account with iTrust, I was told by the company that I had to close the account as New York was no longer a jurisdiction they could operate in - fair enough as things change.  However, almost two months later iTrust continues to delay the disbursement of my funds to Fidelity not-withstanding that all paperwork and forms have been completed.  Fidelity informs me that the company repeatedly promises to get it done but "continues to stonewall".  I did a similar transfer from another financial institution and it took 3 days.  Unless reolved within 48 hours, I will be opening a complaint with the SEC and the BBB.  Wondering if any other customer has actually received funds back from iTrust?

Review.Titre: Extremely poor service
Review.Contenu: Complete lack of customer service. Denial of service without any explanation or reasoning. All information was submitted correctly. Bad company. Will take my business elsewhere!

Review.Titre: If I could leave zero stars I would
Review.Contenu: If I could leave zero stars I wouldIn May I found out my positions were traded back in March and I hadn’t logged on since last year. When I reported it to them, they said there’s nothing they could do but I should be happy my cryptocurrency was sold because it had gone down and no funds were taken out of my account. Rich some high up guy said he’d look into what happened and get back to me and I never heard back. I spent many hrs trying to get things resolved and gave up. Yesterday I tried to login again and was blocked, apparently some suspicious activity. I haven’t been able to get in touch with anyone to help, either by phone, email or live chat.Apparently the CTO Blake and Rich both quit the company. I filed a report with SEC and I want to get my money out if I can get a hold of someone!!! And if there’s anything left in there!!!Update: What are the misconceptions? Everything I stated is 100 percent accurate. And I have proof. Gaslighting!

Review.Titre: The interface is pathetic
Review.Contenu: The interface is pathetic. You can only utilize market orders there is no charts, it was developed by a 12 year old software engineer. These guys don't know what the hell they are doing.

Review.Titre: Being charged for what
Review.Contenu: First, the $25 charge every month is for what?? I waited a month for my $7,700 to be transferred. I’m not impressed with losing money as soon as I transfer it. So I’m being charged to lose money? I’m not with this.

Review.Titre: Not trustworthy of your retirement!
Review.Contenu: Terrible customer service at best.  Perhaps even a scam company I opened a Roth IRA with them without too many issues last year but when I needed to rollover my 401k due to job change and it’s been a disaster.I was given the wrong address for my rollover amount and it’s been in limbo for 3 weeks from vanguard. Review.Titre: Lied To Me, Didn't Fund My Account As Promised + Then Ignored Me
Review.Contenu: Awful. After much research in the digital asset community, and based on recommendations from many, I started the process of funding my account in Oct 2020. This involved a rollover from a Roth IRA with Ellevest (managed by Folio). After submitting all the necessary paperwork on my end, I waited for my account to be funded. I waited. Then I waited some more. After 3 weeks of watching the market start the bull run, my account was still not funded. I had hoped to allocate around $2200 to XRP. I called iTrust. They blamed Folio and said they had no record of a transfer. After hours and hours on the phone with Ellevest and Folio, it was discovered that iTrust NEVER submitted the paperwork. They straight up lied to me. It doesn't stop there. I asked for proof that they submitted the transfer paperwork and do you know what they said? They don't keep fax copies longer than 14 days. Convenient right? And it still gets worse. They charge me a one month fee, even though I had a promo code for the first month free. Not only was that not applied, but they charged me for never doing their job! I lost huge potential gains, and still iTrust has never admitted their mistake. To add insult to injury, the customer experience manager, Anthony...never replied to my email asking to refund the first month fee. Nothing was done in order to make the situation right. They simply ignored me. I watch Anthony go on many programs on YouTube...he is incredibly great at marketing iTrust. Yet, he won't return an email despite his title being about the "customer experience." I followed up with him and asked that my monthly fees be waived for 6 months. He replied that he would waive 3 months of fees. I am honestly blown away that a business handling part of my digital assets would be so incompetent, not take ownership of a mistake, and ignore their customers. Beware, this company is great at taking your money, but God forbid you ask them to do their job, and you will hear radio silence. STAY AWAY!

No acknowledgement about reason why initial phone appointment was missed. No biggie if you at least acknowledge. Not acknowledging the missed appointment even superficially and that I was (wasting my time) waiting around for nothing was definitely off for me customer-service wise. I replied back to email to ask if I could speak to someone else. Got this reply: "You can schedule a call anytime on our website but please only do so if necessary, we are short on time slots." I understand y'alls busy ITrust, we all are. Sounds like you'd rather not have me call?From my vantage point, the initial missed phone call, with no notice, follow-up or acknowledgement ended up getting worse.  I'm a fairly chill and not one for writing up these reviews.  Hope you had a better experience with getting your money right with this group and building that sense of trust. Hope your customer service was more on point and communication wasn't this hasty and off-putting sequence I got the last 24 hours.  I am putting my app on hold after this.[IN RESPONSE TO ITRUST BELOW]I did not receive a phone call the evening of the scheduled call. I was there waiting for the phone call, emailed the rep 2x (with no response) indicating I was waiting.  I did receive a voice mail and email the next day as I noted above.  I can understand things get busy and given the current state of matters, things can fall through the cracks sometimes.  I'm sure you have great service as evidenced by your previous reviews. I am noting the truth of my experience: missed appointment, no acknowledgement of said missed appointment, voicemail next day, email with links, questionable response: "You can schedule a call anytime on our website but please only do so if necessary, we are short on time slots."My scheduled call was from 4:50pm to 5:00pm. Review.Titre: Deceptive Pricing & Misleading Order Types
Review.Contenu: iTrustCapital has deceptive pricing policies and, IMO, seems to take advantage of people who don't know the difference between conditional and limit orders. First, iTrustCapital states that they charge 1% per transaction. Yes, they charge 1% per transaction and that is true! What they DO NOT tell you is that it is a 1% transaction on top of padding the spot price. I'll use BTC for this entire post, but the same goes for any of iTrustCapital's digital assets. For BTC this pad is usually around $25~50 and varies for other digital assets. This is easy to see if you compare the iTrustCapital price of BTC with the spot price of BTC. Google it. So, iTrustCapital are pocketing the spread from their pricing versus spot pricing. Why not just say that in the pricing page? It's disingenuous at best and certainly not clearly stated. From their fee structure page: What are iTrustCapital’s fees? Monthly account cost: $0Cryptocurrency Trades: 1%Physical Gold: $50 over spot per ouncePhysical Silver: $2.50 over spot per ounceNote that for gold and silver they do tell you they pad the spot price, but make no mention of it for cryptocurrency. Additionally, I believe that iTrustCapital aims to take advantage of people who don't know how different kinds of orders work. iTrustCapital has two kinds of orders: market and conditional. Everyone knows what a market order is, but generally people think conditionals are limit orders. They are not. A limit order fills at a price that you pre-determine. If you put a limit buy order for BTC to fill at $20,101.01 and BTC moves to that price, you will buy BTC at $20,101.01, not a cent more or less. A conditional on the other hand is sent as a market order when pricing meets the conditions you set. If you put in a conditional order to buy BTC at $20,101.01, when BTC gets to that price your order will get sent out as a market order. Meaning, you will end up paying something different than your conditional buy price. It can be vastly different in volatile markets. For example, BTC could be at $21,000 and wick down to your conditional price. Your order will be sent out as a market order. If BTC instantly wicks back up, you might end up buying BTC for a substantially higher amount. In another example, say you have set a conditional sell order to be a stop loss in the event of a black swan event. When BTC gets down to your backstop, your order will be sent out. In the meantime, BTC could wick down and you could be filled at hundreds or thousands less than you had intended. I have explained this many times to many people who believe that conditional orders are limit orders. No investor in their right mind would ever use a market order. In this day and age of corporate malfeasance, and bad actors such as the people involved with FTX, companies who care will do a lot more to make people trust them. It's an easy fix for iTrustCapital. 1) Clearly state in their fee structure that they pad the spot price of cryptocurrencies. 2) Clearly explain that iTrustCapital DOES NOT USE limit orders and that conditionals are very different. 3) Give their customers limit orders.

Review.Titre: Not a workable dashboard
Review.Contenu: Not a workable dashboard.  Not able to track the profit/loss on assets owned and purchased. How is this possible that this system can't provide the most basic information.  Not able to place limit or stop loss orders, and iTrustCapital adds $100 to the market price of all purchases, and costs an extra $100 when selling.  Plus a 1% transaction fees.  Not great if you intend on attempting to trade.  Plus monthly maintenance fees.  Looking for other options.

Review.Titre: The pricing on your portal is not good…
Review.Contenu: The pricing on your portal is not good for investors: the buy price is always much higher than the pricing on other platforms at the same time, and the selling price is always much lower than the pricing on other platforms. The difference is much more than 1%. Can you improve your real-time pricing to be more competitive?Also, can you add "Limit Order" functionality? Thank you!

Review.Titre: look somewhere else, crashes during high volume.
Review.Contenu: Unless you want to just buy and hold during a low volume day, look somewhere else. This platform crashes everytime there's high volume. You won't be able to get in your trade when you need to the most. I'm moving to another platform. I initially wrote a good review, but I was wrong. After more time, this platform is horrible. They don't have the ability to support the current users, period. Support is good so I'm giving it a generous 2 stars.

Review.Titre: To talk to a live person you have to…
Review.Contenu: To talk to a live person you have to make an appointment at least three days in advance. And then you only get five minutes. There are no instant transfers through my bank account. You have to do a money wire. There is no insurance against hacking. The fees are lower than some other companies, but still high in my opinion.

Review.Titre: While I appreciate the value you get ......
Review.Contenu: While I appreciate the value.    You cannot place stop or limit orders.  You have to be awake and on their site  to buy or sell.    And they put a s**t coin (Litecoin).    Don’t they know it’s a s**t coin?    I would think they Had done better investigative job.   That’s only drawback.  Other than that    If you HODL you should. Be fine. More coins plz

Review.Titre: There should be stable coins and stop…
Review.Contenu: There should be stable coins and stop limit orders instead of paying exorbitant prices to put back into us dollarThere should be especially with crypto easier and cheaper ways to mitigate your losses when the market goes up and downIt makes me want to rethink if I am doing the right thing keeping my investments in this account

Review.Titre: Review, score D to D-
Review.Contenu: Your fees are massive in this space, one day competition will force a reduction in fees, at that time I will transfer to the alternative broker/custodian. Additionally why should it take 2 weeks to credit a transfer, do you think no one knows what you are doing with the money in the interim?  Finally no phone access is unacceptable, 2 to 3 days to respond by email in unacceptable.  The feeble excuse of too much business and the virus is no excuse. Hire an adequate number of reps to handle your available clientele and business.

Review.Titre: Never received $100 Bitcoin
Review.Contenu: I used a link to sign up which was supposed to give me $100 Bitcoin, then when I had problems getting account set-up, their help center recommended a variety of solutions including signing up incognito. Anyway, was finally able to get account set-up only to have then tell me I didn't use the right link to sign up. I sent an email immediately after account was set-up to make them aware, but basically they didn't seem to care. Now I need to add $750 for balance of 2021 IRA, and they have changed minimum deposit to $1,000 without giving option to allocate some to 2021 and balance to 2022. Other than these customer service issues, seems like one of the better Crypto IRA platforms.

Review.Titre: no stop loss orders?
Review.Contenu: So far, I haven't even been able to figure out how to place a limit or stop loss order, let alone trailing stop loss.  Am I supposed to stay awake 24/7 to make sure I don't lose my savings?  Or is the interface just not intuitive?

Review.Titre: I listened to all the hoopla about this…
Review.Contenu: I listened to all the hoopla about this but the monthly fee eats up anything I am basically making.  I was going to put my retirement money in this account in a few months but am deciding not to.  I understand you have to make money but not at the expense of the little people.

Review.Titre: Fees for purchasing crypto are high
Review.Contenu: Fees for purchasing crypto are high.  Withdrawing money from your account is not intuitive or easy.  The dashboard to buy and sell, although clean and easy to use for a beginner, does not show any typical trading displays like candlestick charts or tools for analysis.  Other platforms show current news related to a specific crypto, this shows none.  Crypto prices on itrustcapital are always quite a bit higher than actual prices, so not only are you paying a high transfer fee but you are also paying a premium to buy crypto here.  It is a great way to get into crypto and defer taxes, but the platform could use some improvement.

Review.Titre: You UX and UI needs a loooooot of work
Review.Contenu: You UX and UI needs a loooooot of work. the quality of you product shows how you care about customers and the service we get. 1-2 stars are because your User Interface doesn't provide any value as other portfolio managements and wallets.Invest in Design!!!

Review.Titre: It took weeks to transfer funds into…Slow Response
Review.Contenu: It took weeks to transfer funds into new Roth. I called many times, requested many times for iTrust to contact my old financial company directly but that did not happen. Transfer should have taken a few minutes not a few weeks to complete.

Review.Titre: Hate
Review.Contenu: Hate, hate hate your website.SlowLacks information Poor to no ways to easily compare products One of the hardest to navigate and poorest thought out site I have to deal with!FIRE YOUR WEBSITE ADMINISTRATOR/DEVELOPER

Review.Titre: Horrible customer service
Review.Contenu: iTrust Capital has a support phone number for onboarding and helping the customer get their funds into their IRA but it is impossible to talk to talk to someone when you are having issues with distributions.   The website says funds will be distributed 7-14 day after the distribution document has been signed,  I have been waiting 4 weeks now.  I have spoken to the support supervisor several times, who still hasn't been able to get a distribution supervisor to call me. Additionally they will not give you a direct phone number or email address to contact them.  Apparently they do not want to be bothered.  My advice, is that if you are at or near retirement, do not use this company.Additional feedback. (8/22/2022)After working with the team mentioned below to directly address and resolve this matter, it still has not been resolved after being assured twice that I would see my funds by the end of the day.  iTrust Capital's distribution processes are broken to the point that even prioritization and escalation fail.

Review.Titre: I have (3) issues/concerns at this…
Review.Contenu: I have (3) issues/concerns at this time. First is not having the ability to deposit less than $1k at a time. Cryptocurrency fluctuates wildly and you give us the ability to trade but not be able to send in less than $1k at a time to build up the account.Second in this day and age and especially dealing with cryptocurrency you should have the capability to transfer money either via a debit/credit card or bank account. Wiring in money or sending in a check is very outdated and old way of doing business at this time.Third what is the possibilities or timeframe for adding more crypto to be able to purchase??

Review.Titre: I started my account because I wanted…
Review.Contenu: I started my account because I wanted to invest solely in XRP and it appeared that you were supportive of the XRP Community. Unfortunately, it does not seem to be the case because you have not re-listed XRP even after the recent developments with the SEC. Now XRP is at $1.44 and climbing and my portfolio has been left in the dust. I am so disappointed in my experience with iTrust at this point. I thought you had the XRP community's back, just like Uphold continues to do. But it is obvious that you don't. If you really want to show the crypto world that you are a groundbreaking company worth being loyal to, then show some integrity and re-list XRP.

Review.Titre: Poor application forms
Review.Contenu: The application process is NOT friendly. You can't just jump to a section that's left off or needs update. Funding process is slow. Can't set recurring buys or limit orders.

Review.Titre: Very slow and inefficient
Review.Contenu: I rolled over funds from other institution, its been 14 business days since it cleared there, still not showing up in the itrust account. It is hard to reach a human, they dont have contact numbers. Disappointed...

Review.Titre: Wish the monthly fee is none cause you…
Review.Contenu: Wish the monthly fee is none cause you charge fee for each transaction already. And wish Xrp relisting much earlier...I'm missing such a great opportunity 😞 I'm missing out growth

Review.Titre: Poor Customer Services, Failed Promises
Review.Contenu: I started last year with itrust capital and initially they seem to be providing good customer care, but that went south when required reporting was asked for (form 5498). I was told I would receive the reporting and even end of year reports, but that never happened. I was given the run-around and customer service became very poor. There was misrepresentation about my contributions as well. Also per email to all customers, they promised to  send customer balances for spark tokens ten days after December 12th, and I never received the email. Are they selective in how customers are treated? Pretty much all requests I have had has been ignored and promises have not been kept. This has been terrible and wish they can take better care of customers.

Review.Titre: This is a good service but needs to improve the customer experience.
Review.Contenu: This is a good service, but you guys are lacking some very important things to provide a great consumer experience.You need an automated way to fund the account.  Plaid is one option that may help with that.You need a mobile app.  As a consumer, I like having a button I can press on my phone to check my account status and asset performance.As a consumer, I'm not as likely to recommend this to friends, because it's pretty cumbersome and takes a while to get started.  I know a lot of my friends are not likely to persevere through the process, and are likely to get annoyed with me if I send them to you.  I applaud your current success, but I think you can do even better.  I also appreciate your company providing a Roth IRA option for gold and bitcoin.

Review.Titre: On Dec 5th
Review.Contenu: On Dec 5th, I mailed my wife's and my first installment.  It was like waiting for paint to dry for you guys to receive this.  I hate coinbase but Itrust is even worse at investing money.  Your company charges monthly and I would think there would be better customer service.  All I received were talking points and lies.  It took 15 days for my money to get invested and 20 days for my wife.  Let's just try and blame it on the postal service.  I wired money the second time and I wasn't any happier.  Your customer service is horrible.  I would think you would try harder with new accounts.  Then you stop trading xrp because of a lawsuit that hasn't been finalized.  It seems Uphold knows more than your company and doesn't stop things on hearsay.  How does it feel to be just as terrible as coinbase.

Review.Titre: The user interface needs some work
Review.Contenu: The user interface needs some work. I understand you want to keep it simple, but it's a bit too simple. The portfolio manager can be simple and easy to use and look much more sleek and modern. I personally like the Voyager app for crypto. You should check out their interface for some design ideas. A pie chart of your holdings by percentage would be much more efficient then your bar design for each asset. I would also add a field for the total P&L so users can see account performance at a glance vs only their account balance. Another idea would be to add a user chat forum. Itrust users could share trading strategies and and other market information. This could possibly encourage more trading activity and fees for Itrust. Please feel free to contact me for any further ideas to improve the user experience.Thanks,Ryan S

Review.Titre: waiting for stop orders.
Review.Contenu: Service is good but still would like to see the ability to use stop orders to buy and sell instead of only market orders.  Once that happens I would give it 5 stars.

Review.Titre: Horrendous Customer Service
Review.Contenu: I've been a customer for approximately one year. Overall, I'm satisfied with the actual management of the account, but customer service is horrible. If reliable customer service is a deal-breaker for you, be warned:1) The online help bots are terrible. They cannot accurately answer any question I have ever had.2) There is no way to call their company. It's just a recorded message.3) You can schedule a call with customer service, but you'll have to wait about a week. Scheduled calls are only 5 minutes, so be ready and don't forget to ask anything or it's another 1-week wait for you.4) You can email their support team, which is the fastest way to get in touch, but responders frequently don't fully answer questions, so it will take multiple email exchanges to get support.5) Their 'corporate' office address is a rent-a-room office building. Their 'mailing' address is box at a UPS Store.

Review.Titre: lack of customer support
Review.Contenu: UI not the best, specifically when placing purchase orders. Also, transferring money is not easy. Customer service is not available fast enough.

Review.Titre: Your Rollover Process SUCKS!!!
Review.Contenu: First, the rollover process was absolutely horrible. My check was mailed to you and received on a Wednesday morning, you said it would be processed after a 3day hold or something. well by Friday it still had not even been processed and the 3-day timer did not start. I didn't have access to my money for almost two weeks after you received it. I had two accounts a ROTH an a traditional, and the traditional was held up even longer and I was not able to start trading. the prices during that time when I was not able to trade were the lowest during the bear market and I lost the opportunity to captilize on the price. So that was my first expereince with your company and the based on the calls with your staff I was left feeling regret having sent my funds to your platform. Now that I have been using it, one feature you need to add is the ability to set multiple conditional orders, and the ability to dollar cost average into assets. You should allow multiple conditional buy and sell orders on the same coin. Also need the ability to see the average price per coin bought and show better performance analysis and reports. overall portfolio performance, individual coin performance, etc.

Review.Titre: I sold a coin
Review.Contenu: I sold a coin, I wanted the proceeds to go to buy another coin. So the proceeds were suppose to goto USD but instead sent to my bank account.

Review.Titre: Be aware
Review.Contenu: Be aware, the company has done away with there monthly fee, good right? But......You can only place market orders and the spread is terrible! Traded BTC & was $80 to $200 above the price you could buy it on other exchanges (plus your 1% fee). It looks like they are making up the monthly fee they were charging with fees (spreads) elsewhere. The old bait and switch. The site has gone down (not able to make a trade a couple times) at the worst time. Also, there offer of $100 in BTC is suspect. When I have inquired about it, I have gotten some kind of a BOT response pushing the date back. For the most part customer service replies doesn't seem to address my issue directly (seem like generic responses). By the way, if you call them on their issues on Twitter they will block you . You will only see the comments they want you to see.I stand corrected... I misspoke (or mistyped). It is 1% over their market price. The numbers speak for themselves. Not a good experience with Customer Service.

Review.Titre: can’t put in buy orders. Absurd!
Review.Contenu: can’t put in buy orders. Absurd. So I will have to wake up in the middle of the night to catch a favorable moments in the market.

Review.Titre: Disappointed in communication and lack of transparency
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed in the lack of transparency and communication with the recent breach.

Review.Titre: Would like to see "Limit Order"…
Review.Contenu: Would like to see "Limit Order" capability added for trading.  Also noticed some delay reflecting "real time" price.

Review.Titre: my second rollover did not go over so…
Review.Contenu: my second rollover did not go over so well. There was a delay in delivery of the funds due to lack of timely communications from Itrust. The wore instructions were not followed properly resulting in the custodian mailing the check and delaying funding by over a week. Markets don't stop for the USPS. Dissatisfied that email communications took over 72 hours. That is not an acceptable response time. There was no phone number provided to call until after I asked for one. I requested a call back online and that took over 3 days. This could have easily been prevented had staff taken time to resolve the issue and spend a little more time on the process. Other than that my trades have gone well and the monthly fee and 1% trade fees are competitive. Think they are extremely busy and short staffed. They have assured me they are working on hiring and training. However thay does not replace the three days of trading that was missed while BTC hit ATH. Has yet to return to pre funding day levels. Not too excited about that.

Review.Titre: You need to make funding the account…
Review.Contenu: You need to make funding the account easier. There is no way I'm giving a 3rd party my info to do an ACH.

Review.Titre: Unreliable deposits
Review.Contenu: I have been using iTrustCapital for 5-6 months, and have had very inconsistent results when it comes to adding cash funds to my account.  2 of the 5 deposits took several weeks to reach my account, the most recent issue has been 3 weeks, with little to no customer service feedback in my inquires.  As far as once the money is there, and the ease of using the system, they are good, but being in limbo and not knowing where several thousand dollars are can be stressful, and I would have hoped for better customer service.Update:  Over 4 weeks now and still they can't find my $6,000 I sent.  I've had to send emails and messages through their system several times, repeating myself because I've been passed onto another customer service rep.  I only started getting feedback once I used a direct email that I had in the past to another employee (the automated system may have just been redirecting my comments to an unassigned box, I don't know).  I hope they resolve this soon, but I've missed the BTC dip because of all of this.

Review.Contenu: My ira rollover came to itrust on 9/23 and i had to call twice to track it down, first time there was no record

Review.Titre: System down all weekend!!
Review.Contenu: System down all weekend!!! Unacceptable

Review.Titre: What I learned 2 days after…
Review.Contenu: What I learned 2 days after establishing the account. The costs at 1% per trade seem excessive but not sure if there are any gas costs included. The available tokens to trade are very limited. This is not coinbase. Plus you cannot make limit orders which means you probably pay the highest market price. Customer service is unresponsive to email requests. You need to make a phone appointment?!!  I think they are overwhelmed and one has to wonder why. The platform is decent and simple but I am waiting for something more advanced and lower cost. This is not a good option for active trading in my opinion. Look before you leap._________________________post review comments:After posting my review I received an immediate  phone call on my mobile from itrust and a message that basically said my review was not true and that I should go setup an account somewhere else. Not sure why someone would feel the need to call me at night on 12/30 with an attitude. My motivation is simple - to help make your company be better. That you would act so defensive is disturbing. First off, you send me an email asking for my review, I give you 2 stars then you ask for comments, I give you my honest feedback, then you question MY motivations?!!  So if a review is less than stellar, you attack? Not a smart strategy. The entire response misses the point and is misleading. I did not say your 1% fee was non-competitive - I said it seemed excessive. I did not say I could not trade on the account, I have of course place some buy orders. I did not say anything about stop orders - which are for stop loss selling, not buying. Limit buy orders are what I mentioned. Perhaps you do not know the difference or maybe just respond with robotic scripts like the emails you said I received. Please do not  play this game. I am only trying to help.

Review.Titre: Too many fees
Review.Contenu: Too many fees. Nickle and dimed on every transaction.

Review.Titre: Struggle to deposit funds into IRA…
Review.Contenu: Struggle to deposit funds into IRA account!

Review.Titre: Does not let you withdraw your money
Review.Contenu: On 12/1/2020, I sent a message requesting a CARES act withdrawal. I was told that the instructions and forms will be sent within 1-2 days. I already updated the message request #19810 several times, and still no reply.On 12/9/2020, I scheduled a call and did not get the call on the appointed time. I only got a call when I replied to the appointment e-mail sent by Carol Medel and asked why nobody called. When I got her call, she told me that she will send me the withdrawal forms and instructions that night. But until now, almost 3 weeks later, I still do not have instructions/forms or any other communication from ITrust.On 12/15/2020, I sent another message (request # 22973). I got a response from Rich Hauschild saying "We are currently inundated with requests and are working through them, we apologize for the delay.We will follow up with you soon."On 12/23/2020, I sent this message to the request # referenced above:"Thank you for your response. But my concern is that this is a CARES withdrawal, which I specified in my previous requests, and the CARES act is about to expire. What happens if you still don't get to process this request before the expiration date? I shouldn't be penalized (due to your delay) since I made the request way before the expiration date, right?"I never got a response on this.Why can't I withdraw my money?? At least post the instructions and forms on your website so customers can initiate the withdrawal process. How long and how hard is it to send instructions and forms??The lack of communication and professionalism is very frustrating, and all I am requesting is a withdrawal which I believe should not even take this long. Especially during this time when it is really needed.In the beginning, they were very professional in taking my money. But now that I desperately need it and ask for it, they won't even give me the time and day and ignore my request.UPDATE:12/31/2020 - Received the requested funds. Thank you for expediting this and getting the funds to me before the end of the year.

Review.Titre: Be prepared to hassle
Review.Contenu: I started the process of transferring a sizable chunk of cash from one IRA over to iTrust 8 WEEKS ago. After completing the forms and instructions for a transfer on their website, I got an email telling me to keep a close eye on my account messages and email inbox over the next 1-3 business days to DocuSign a couple of documents. 2 full weeks later I hadn't received anything, so I sent a message to customer support. To their credit, that same day I got a message back that the documents don't actually arrive via email (despite what the earlier email said) and that they're ready for me to sign. I had just checked my account messages prior to reaching out, so it's clear that my note to them is what prompted the documents suddenly being ready. Fine, at least they were ready. I signed what needed to be signed, carefully read over everything to see if any further action would be needed from me, didn't see anything, and so expected to see the transfer show up in 3-5 business days. I gave it 9 business days before getting in touch again. 2 days later I got a message that a transfer form needed to be filled out. Again, nothing in the two previous rounds of paperwork mentioned this, and I had already provided the account number and institution name that the funds would be transferring from in the earlier paperwork. Fine. I filled out the transfer form. 5 days later I sent another message to customer service, as I hadn't seen any movement on either the iTrust account or the funding account, and by now I was starting to feel that the only way the next step in the process was triggered was by me pinging customer service. Sure enough, suddenly the transfer started 2 days later. I waited the 5 business days that I was seeing the (pending) notation on the funding account. 2 business days ago, the money showed as settled on the funding account side, and was gone from that account. I logged on to iTrust and it still showed as pending. I waited 2 days to give them the benefit of the doubt. Today it's still pending on their side, and settled and gone from the funding side. I reached out again today, but I'm tired of having to do this for every single step. They don't seem to have a process in place where one completed event triggers the next, and things only happen when I send a message. It could be worse, at least so far sending a message has made things happen. My advice is to be proactive and don't assume that finishing one task will prompt the next to begin.

Review.Titre: Wanted to change the email address on…
Review.Contenu: Wanted to change the email address on my account. Only on-line option I found was to open a support ticket, which I did. I got an automated email back with a link to schedule a verification call, which I did. At the scheduled time I waited at the phone for 30 mins. No call. I then called the support number and waited. When I finally got through to a person I was told they don't use the scheduling! The guy told me he'd email me a docusign link for the change. I have still not received that email.Edit: Grant called me back with an apology and had fixed everything.

Review.Titre: The customer service staff are not…
Review.Contenu: The customer service staff are not professional, knowledgeable, or helpful in my experiece. I can hear 14 people talking in the background when I call..it's bit distracting. The website needs MAJOR improvements in both design and function. I've linked my bank to the "new" banking system 10 times now and keep getting a message to link my account. After calling customer service they were completely baffled and said they had to get to their tech team to figure out why. So now I can't make a contribution...very sub-par.

Review.Titre: Limitations…why? Ask us what coins should be made available.
Review.Contenu: Not sure how they are connected with Coinbase.. but do not provide the selection as in Coinbase.  Limited asset choices…DOGE, SHIB really!  What about QNT, HBAR, providing and backing up XRP( Uphold has gonads), CSPR, LCX, VET, XDC, DAG utility coins that actually solve a problem around the world with significant purpose. Your coins should reflect the latest technology and future.

Review.Titre: loved starting my own account but the…
Review.Contenu: loved starting my own account but the reward for a referral being an electronic card was difficult for myself and my friend we both seemed to lose the bonus and were not able to convert it to a useable card. We both thought it would just be added to our account.

Review.Titre: Delay in funding
Review.Contenu: I had some trouble getting the account funded. J in customer service was quite responsive. I hope they can resolve whatever technical issues they have from time to time. In the end, it seems to have worked out. My account was funded.

Review.Titre: Delays in completing IRA to Roth conversion
Review.Contenu: It took three requests to completely close an IRA account I fully converted to a Roth IRA earlier this year. Twice there were small amounts of few cryptos improperly remaining in the IRA account.All assets were finally transferred and the IRA account was closed today.

Review.Titre: You guys support crypto currency in…
Review.Contenu: You guys support crypto currency in general and not bitcoin. That’s not healthy for long term investing. You should make bitcoin happen and leave the rest alone

Review.Titre: Ease of Use
Review.Contenu: I don't like that I have to go to my history to see what the previous purchase price of coins was at the time of purchase. This makes it difficult to determine which coins I should be dollar cost averaging into.

Review.Titre: I like the app but, it could improve.
Review.Contenu: I like the app, would really just like to have more investment options. Such as Sugar, Beans, Oil, natural gas, etc. If that was an option I’d give it 5 stars.

Review.Titre: ACH transfers take too long
Review.Contenu: It always takes at least five actual days for ACH transfers to go through. I’ve had two wrote to ask for status on two previous transfers.  Other than that everything is cool.

Review.Titre: Minimum contribution amt too high + difficulty in reaching customer service
Review.Contenu: I dislike that the minimum contribution amount is $1k, this makes it difficult to add funds to my account. I also had challenges in connecting with a support POC in the beginning, not having a phone number to speak to a customer service agent is not ideal.

Review.Titre: I don't like that I can't stake ADA
Review.Contenu: I don't like that I can't stake ADA. I also wish we had more traditional asset selection.

Review.Titre: Love how easy it is but you should…
Review.Contenu: Love how easy it is but you should lower to 100 instead of 500 dollars because most people can invest 100 weekly rather than 500. I have so many people that want to join but 500 it to much.

Review.Contenu: I love the concept but the offerings are very very limited with very few speculative coins/tokens to bet on.
